wikipedia_page.main: Thomas Blore (1754–1818) was an English topographer.

response: He was born in Derby, the son of the antiquarian writer Thomas Blore.
Clutterbuck used collections of Thomas Blore.
*Thomas Blore, History and Antiquities of the County of Rutland (1811, partial)

link_mentions.page: St Mary on Paddington Green Church

response: He went into business at Stamford, Lincolnshire as a printer and book-seller at the beginning of the 19th century. On 15 September 1809 he started a weekly paper, the Stamford News.Dictionary of National Biography, Drakard, John (1775?–1854), newspaper proprietor and publisher, by G. F. R. Barker. Published 1888. The first editor was the topographer Thomas Blore, but he and Drakard soon fell out.The Reliquary and Illustrated Archæologist vol. III (1862–3), p. 9; archive.org.
